macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stock Markets Close Lower on Friday with Tech Sector Leading Declines
items.summary: The S&P 500 fell 0.4% to 6,930.03, Dow Jones dropped 0.36-0.4% to 48,892.47, and Nasdaq Composite declined 0.94-1.10% to 23,461.82, driven by weakness in technology and materials sectors despite a small gain from Apple post-earnings.

items.title: Asian Markets Mixed as US Retreat Continues into Monday
items.summary: Asian indices showed divergence with Nikkei up 0.31%, Hang Seng down 1.76-2%, Shanghai Composite down 1.1%, and S&P/ASX 200 down 0.65-1.1%; US futures also slipping amid broader risk-off sentiment.

items.title: Central Banks in Focus: RBA May Hike, ECB and BoE Expected to Hold
items.summary: Markets price over 70% chance of RBA rate hike to 3.85% amid strong jobs and inflation data; ECB likely to keep rates as inflation nears 2% target, BoE to hold at 3.75% post-hawkish cut.

items.title: Tesla Shares Rise 3.3% After Strong Quarterly Profit Report
items.summary: Tesla rebounded 3.3% on Friday, limiting broader US market losses, following better-than-expected quarterly profits despite an initial drop on Thursday.

items.title: Commodities Volatile: Oil Plunges 3.5%, Gold Up Slightly After Steep Weekly Drop
items.summary: Crude oil fell 3.5% to $62.93 per barrel, natural gas down 14.97%, while gold rose 0.27% to $4,758.10 after a 17% plunge from highs triggered by new Fed chair nomination.

items.title: US 10-Year Yield Rises to 4.18% as USD Strengthens
items.summary: US 10-year Treasury yield increased 1.09% to 4.18%, USD Index up 0.83% to 96.86, reflecting shifting rate expectations amid central bank meetings.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Slips Below $77,000 Amid Market Pressure and Liquidations
items.summary: Bitcoin dropped 5.2% to $75,501 in the past 24 hours, with the total crypto market cap falling 2.8% to $2.6 trillion due to thin liquidity, heavy leverage, and forced liquidations. Altcoins like XRP (-4.5% to $1.59), Chainlink (-5.5% to $9.48), and Monero (-12% to $405) saw heavier losses amid geopolitical tensions and U.S. regulatory uncertainty.

items.title: Ethereum Faces Sharp Declines Despite Recent BPO Hard Fork Upgrade
items.summary: Ethereum fell to around $2,500, down over 10% in a single day last week due to liquidations, nearly half its peak of $5,000, even after a January BPO protocol upgrade to improve scalability and efficiency. Layer-2 solutions continue to rise, reducing mainnet load and fees.

items.title: Bitcoin Nears One-Year Lows at $77,334, Down 11.7% Weekly
items.summary: Bitcoin tumbled 1.6% overnight to $77,334 amid outflows from spot ETFs, rising interest in gold/silver as safe havens, geopolitical risks, and fading hopes for U.S. Fed rate cuts. Ethereum dropped 7.1% to $2,275, down 20.5% weekly.

items.title: Bitcoin Breaks Below $76,000, Signaling Prolonged Bear Market
items.summary: Bitcoin slipped below $76,000 in thin trading, down 40% from 2025 peak and marking its fourth straight monthly decline, the longest since 2018, due to fading demand, thinning liquidity, and competition from other assets. Analysts predict no new all-time high in 2026, with volume contractions echoing past bear markets.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Square Enix Announces Killer Inn Early Access Launch
items.summary: Square Enix revealed that multiplayer murder-mystery action game Killer Inn will launch in Early Access on PC via Steam on February 12, priced at $9.99 USD with optional cosmetics. The team seeks player feedback to refine the game before full release.

items.title: Compile Heart Announces School RPG Villion: Code
items.summary: Compile Heart has announced Villion: Code, a new school RPG created by Megami Tensei and Persona co-creator Kouji Okada, initially for Japan with hopes for a Western release.

items.title: Updated Disney Afternoon Collection Coming to Switch and Switch 2
items.summary: Atari and Digital Eclipse are releasing an updated Disney Afternoon Collection for Switch and Switch 2 later this month, adding Goof Troop and Bonkers to the lineup of NES/SNES classics.

items.title: Lost Beavis and Butt-Head PS1 Prototypes Resurface
items.summary: Prototypes of a cancelled Beavis and Butt-Head PS1 game have been discovered, amid a resurgence in popularity for the duo.

items.title: Five New Steam Games Highlighted for February 2
items.summary: PC Gamer spotlights overlooked Steam releases including Don't Stop, Girlypop!, Space Warlord Baby Trading Simulator, Bogos Binted?, Millennium Dream, and Valkyrie Saga, noting innovative indie titles amid daily releases.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.
